0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency: 2 tablets (1000 mg) ORALLY with each meal and 2 tablets (1000 mg) taken with food eaten between meals

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness in children have not been established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
  • Mechanical complication of device - Tube feeding of patient

0.title: Contraindications
0.mono: hypersensitivity to pancreatin or to pork protein

2.title: Pregnancy Category
2.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Perianal pain, Infants, Rash
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal discomfort, Nausea, Oral cavity finding, Vomiting
  • Ophthalmic:Finding of lacrimation
  • Renal:Increased uric acid level, High doses
  • Respiratory:Sneezing

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• abdominal discomfort and bloating
  • urinalysis and blood chemistry at high doses

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause abdominal discomfort, nausea, vomiting, or sneezing. High doses of pancreatin may cause perianal pain or hyperuricemia.
  • Patient should take with meals and swallow tablets quickly to decrease potential for mouth irritation.
  • Tell patients taking higher doses to maintain adequate hydration while taking this drug.
